Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, showing specific examples (e.g., a forest and a pond).
The student can illustrate and label at least three different types of plants in each habitat, indicating their diversity.
The student can illustrate and label at least three different types of animals in each habitat, showing a variety of species.
The student can make comparisons by drawing patterns or examples of similarities and differences between the types of plants and animals found in the two habitats.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate how observations of habitats and living organisms can show patterns of biodiversity.
